articles.title: Public Presentation on Greatness of Kim Jong Il Held
DPRK Holiday Observed in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Holiday Observed in Different Countries 
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- More colorful functions took place in different countries in the run-up to the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 A meeting and an art performance took place in Sofia, an art performance was given by the Kim Jong Il Class of the Ali Ali Middle School in Karachi and a broadcasting soiree was organized by the Democracia Broadcasting Service of Ecuador from Jan. 15 to 31.
 On display in the venues of functions were photos showing the undying exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and photos titled "Celebrations of the 60th Anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea" and "By Our Nation Itself".
 Milcho Gyuvrov, vice-chairman of the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association, said in a speech at a meeting that the Korean people are working fresh miracles and innovations in various fields including politics, economy and culture under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.    
 He wished the Korean people greater success in their struggle to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation and hasten the peaceful reunification of the country, bravely overcoming obstacles and difficulties, true to the Songun politics.
 The chief of school affairs of the Pakistani middle school in a speech before the celebration performance said: We have strengthened the friendship and fraternal ties with the Korean people, always remembering the class's high honor and happiness of going by the august name of Kim Jong Il and having his portrait displayed there. 
 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting held in Bulgaria.
 Korean songs including "Song of General Kim Jong Il" and immortal classic work "Song of Korea" and songs and dances of respective countries were staged on the occasions.

articles.title: DPRK Holidays to Be Commemorated in Brazil
articles.content:
DPRK Holidays to Be Commemorated in Brazil 
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the Brazilian preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun and Feb. 16 was held in Brasilia on Jan. 31.
 Present there were figures from all works of life including the general secretary of the October 8 Revolutionary Movement of Brazil.    
 The ceremony elected Nilson Araujo de Souza, chairman of the Brazil-Korea Friendship Association, chairman of the preparatory committee.
 The preparatory committee decided to organize various events including meeting and lecture in the period from February to April.

articles.title: Songun Politics of DPRK Praised by Foreign Figures
New Fact about S. Korea's Submission to U.S. Disclosed
articles.content:
New Fact about S. Korea's Submission to U.S. Disclosed 
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- A fact about how the south Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade supported the "strategic flexibility" of the U.S. forces in south Korea, a manifestation of its submission to Washington, was recently disclosed, stirring public criticism, according to south Korean CBS.
 Choe Jae Chon, lawmaker from the south Korean Uri Party, at a press interview on Feb. 2 disclosed the fact that the ministry exchanged with the United States notes fully supporting the "strategic flexibility" of its forces in south Korea in October 2003.
 At that time the ministry exchanged this diplomatic note with the U.S. without informing Chongwadae of it, he said.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Russian Diplomats Held
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Russian Diplomats Held 
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting between officials of the DPRK Foreign Ministry and staff members of the Russian embassy here was held on Tuesday on the occasion of leader Kim Jong Il's birthday.
 Present there were officials of the ministry and the Russian ambassador and staff members of the embassy.    
 The participants talked to each other about the issue of further developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in various fields and had sports games, deepening friendship.

articles.title: Film Show and Friendly Meeting Arranged for Cultural Attaches
articles.content:
Film Show and Friendly Meeting Arranged for Cultural Attaches 
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Culture hosted a film show and a friendly meeting for cultural attaches of different embassies here at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday to celebrate the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il.
 Present there were officials of the ministry including Vice-Minister Jo Chan Gu and moviemen.    
 The participants appreciated a Korean feature film "Where My New Life Began.
 After the film show the participants talked to each other about further developing cooperation and exchange among countries in the cultural and art fields and sang songs, deepening friendship.

Japan Urged to Settle Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Settle Past Crimes
    Pyongyang February 8 (KCNA) -- Japan should clearly understand the Korean's indignation at it and their resolution and liquidate its past crimes as early as possible, urges Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed article.
 Japan is a criminal state that perpetrated aggression and plunder against Korea for a long period and inflicted the fate of a colonial slave upon the Koreans, the article says, and goes on:    
 The nearly half a century-long harsh colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists over Korea was characterized by the hideous moves to exterminate the Korean nation.
 The most hideous crime committed by Japan in the past was that it killed Koreans in a brutal manner.    
 The Japanese imperialist ogres massacred more than one million Koreans.
 During their colonial rule over Korea, the Japanese imperialists forcibly drafted or kidnapped more than 8.4 million young and middle-aged Koreans and forced them to do medieval slave labor or used them as cannon fodder in their wars.
 The most horrendous crime committed by the Japanese imperialists against humanity was that they forced 200,000 Korean women into sexual slavery. They indiscriminately vandalized or looted valuable cultural treasures of Korea in a bid to stamp out the time-honored history and advantages of the Korean nation and root out its soul.
 They deprived the Koreans of even their written and spoken languages and their names and tried to remove national custom peculiar to the Koreans and looted huge natural treasures and products of Korea lock, stock and barrel. 
 The Japanese imperialists are the sworn enemy of the Koreans as they inflicted incurable wounds on the Koreans, the article says, stressing that all the crimes the Japanese imperialists committed in the past are still fresh in the memory of the Koreans, who are firmly determined to certainly force Japan to pay for those crimes.

articles.title: Bush's Reckless Remarks Blasted in S. Korea
articles.content:
Bush's Reckless Remarks Blasted in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea reportedly issued a statement on Feb. 1 blasting the reckless remarks of U.S. President Bush.
 The statement accused Bush of terming the north "undemocratic state" in his state of the union address made on Jan. 31 when referring to "freedom" and "democracy." 
 The United States is a disturber of world peace, an outpost of tyranny and a criminal state that has driven humankind into instability and horror with its unjust war of aggression, the statement noted.    
 Assailing Bush for making accusations against the north again out of his inveterate bitterness toward the north and consciousness of confrontation, the statement said this is little short of overturning the joint statement adopted at the fourth round of the six-party talks.

articles.title: Nationwide Struggle to Defend Peace Called for
Chairman of 14th-term Hanchongryon Elected
articles.content:
Chairman of 14th-term Hanchongryon Elected
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- Hanchongryon (the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils) reportedly held an extraordinary meeting of deputies to Hanchongryon at Yonsei University on Feb. 5 at which Jang Song Hoe, chairman of the General Student Council of Chonnam National University, was elected chairman of the 14th-term Hanchongryon.
 The inaugural declaration of the 14th-term Hanchongryon noted that it would stage a vigorous struggle for resolutely checking the U.S. moves for permanent division of Korea and the building of a "great alliance of New Rights" and the attempt to set up a pro-American "government" in south Korea, and take the lead in the patriotic movement for independent reunification, peace against war and overall national unity.
 Action programs of the 14th-term Hanchongryon were announced at the meeting.
 Then followed the inaugural ceremony of the 14th-term Hanchongryon.
 An "evening for the legalization of Hanchongryon" took place in the same venue on the evening of Feb. 4.

articles.title: Japan's Unjust Discrimination against Chongryon Blasted
articles.content:
Japan's Unjust Discrimination against Chongryon Blasted
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries have become frantic in their moves to suppress and discriminate the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) over the issue of exempting the Korean Hall in Kumamoto, Japan, a facility related to Chongryon, from the tax payment. 
 This hall has been widely used as a place not only for a series of cultural activities to defend the rights of the Koreans in Japan and their life and improve their social and cultural attainments and support the aged but also for economic and cultural exchange to develop the DPRK-Japan friendly relations. For this reason its public nature has been recognized for the last several decades and it has been exempted from the payment of some taxes including the property tax.    
 Nevertheless, an ultra-right wing organization of the city brought this case of tax exemption to the court of the city, asserting that it was an illegal measure. 
 Last year the court turned down the case at the first hearing, claiming that the hall was of public nature and its tax exemption was not against the law in view of its users, its facilities and their management and its service, etc.    
 But the Fukuoka High Court at a trial on an appeal held on Feb. 2 overturned the judgment made at the first trial by ruling that the hall's tax exemption be canceled. 
 It is the first time the Japanese judicial authorities ruled that the tax exemption of the facility related to Chongryon was illegal, denying its public nature.
 The Information Office of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon dismissed the judgment made by the high court as an unjust one as it stokes discrimination against Chongryon and the Koreans in Japan.

New Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued in DPRK
    Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- The Korea Stamp Corporation has issued a separate stamp and a sheetlet reflecting plants growing in Mt. Paektu area on the occasion of the auspicious February holiday, the birthday of leader  Kim Jong Il.
 Thousands of species of plants grow in the area of Mt. Paektu, the sacred mountain of revolution.    
 Among them are many rare plants indigenous to alpine areas.
 Printed on the stamps are words "Celebration of the great leader Comrade Kim Jong Il's Birthday", "Juche 31(1942)-Juche 95(2006)" and "February 16".
 The separate stamp shows a scenic view of the Mt. Paektu area where various flowers are in full bloom with the peak on which the words "Jong Il Peak" are carved out as its background.    
 The sheetlet reflects four species of alpine plants including Polemonium racemosum, morning-star lily and dandelion growing in the Jong Il Peak area.
 The face value of the separate stamp is 3 won and those of the stamps in the sheetlet are 12, 45, 100 and 140 won respectively.
